    • Method Detail

      • createExtraParams

        protected Map<String,List<String>> createExtraParams()

      • getEncoding

        public EncodingEnum getEncoding()
        Returns the encoding that will be used on requests. Default is null, which means the client will not explicitly request an encoding. (This is standard behaviour according to the FHIR specification)

      • getHttpClient

        public org.apache.http.client.HttpClient getHttpClient()
        Do not call this method in client code. It is a part of the internal HAPI API and is subject to change!
        Specified by:
        getHttpClient in interface IRestfulClient

      • getLastResponseBody

        public String getLastResponseBody()
        For now, this is a part of the internal API of HAPI - Use with caution as this method may change!

      • getPrettyPrint

        public Boolean getPrettyPrint()
        Returns the pretty print flag, which is a request to the server for it to return "pretty printed" responses. Note that this is currently a non-standard flag (_pretty) which is supported only by HAPI based servers (and any other servers which might implement it).

      • getServerBase

        public String getServerBase()
        Base URL for the server, with no trailing "/"
        Specified by:
        getServerBase in interface IRestfulClient

      • getUrlBase

        public String getUrlBase()

        public boolean isKeepResponses()
        For now, this is a part of the internal API of HAPI - Use with caution as this method may change!

      • isPrettyPrint

        public boolean isPrettyPrint()
        Returns the pretty print flag, which is a request to the server for it to return "pretty printed" responses. Note that this is currently a non-standard flag (_pretty) which is supported only by HAPI based servers (and any other servers which might implement it).

      • registerInterceptor

        public void registerInterceptor(IClientInterceptor theInterceptor)
        Description copied from interface: IRestfulClient
        Register a new interceptor for this client. An interceptor can be used to add additional logging, or add security headers, or pre-process responses, etc.
        Specified by:
        registerInterceptor in interface IRestfulClient

      • setDontValidateConformance

        public void setDontValidateConformance(boolean theDontValidateConformance)
        This method is an internal part of the HAPI API and may change, use with caution. If you want to disable the loading of conformance statements, use IRestfulClientFactory.setServerValidationModeEnum(ServerValidationModeEnum)

      • setEncoding

        public void setEncoding(EncodingEnum theEncoding)
        Sets the encoding that will be used on requests. Default is null, which means the client will not explicitly request an encoding. (This is perfectly acceptable behaviour according to the FHIR specification. In this case, the server will choose which encoding to return, and the client can handle either XML or JSON)
        Specified by:
        setEncoding in interface IRestfulClient
        Parameters:
        theEncoding - The encoding to use in the request, or null not specify an encoding (which generally implies the use of XML). The default is null.

      • setKeepResponses

        public void setKeepResponses(boolean theKeepResponses)
        For now, this is a part of the internal API of HAPI - Use with caution as this method may change!

      • setLastResponse

        public void setLastResponse(org.apache.http.HttpResponse theLastResponse)
        For now, this is a part of the internal API of HAPI - Use with caution as this method may change!

      • setLastResponseBody

        public void setLastResponseBody(String theLastResponseBody)
        For now, this is a part of the internal API of HAPI - Use with caution as this method may change!

      • setPrettyPrint

        public void setPrettyPrint(Boolean thePrettyPrint)
        Sets the pretty print flag, which is a request to the server for it to return "pretty printed" responses. Note that this is currently a non-standard flag (_pretty) which is supported only by HAPI based servers (and any other servers which might implement it).
        Specified by:
        setPrettyPrint in interface IRestfulClient
        Parameters:
        thePrettyPrint - The pretty print flag to use in the request (default is false)

      • unregisterInterceptor

        public void unregisterInterceptor(IClientInterceptor theInterceptor)
        Description copied from interface: IRestfulClient
        Remove an intercaptor that was previously registered using IRestfulClient.registerInterceptor(IClientInterceptor)
        Specified by:
        unregisterInterceptor in interface IRestfulClient
